455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 11:59 AM";"can anybody other than mihailo describe how it is possible for mempool tx to be dPoW protected";"";"";

423176312354635779;"gcharang#6833";"04-Oct-18 12:06 PM";"First fund the channels cc address of the recepient. Wait for the tx to  be dPOW protected so it can't be reorged. This funding utxo can only be claimed by the recipient if he can produce a secret.
So when the sender reveals a secret
column2: the recipient can claim the funds that correspond to it. This funding will be valid till the channel close tx hits the mempool";"";"";

column1: 371114647052615681;"Mylo#8306";"04-Oct-18 12:06 PM";"After tx that creates the channel tx goes into dPoW.  The channel tx (split into 1000) can only be spent once.";"";"";

423176312354635779;"gcharang#6833";"04-Oct-18 12:11 PM";"Also the channel close will take effect after the next notarization. So all the funds whose secrets are revealed will be claimable even if there was a reorg attempt";"";"";

371114647052615681;"Mylo#8306";"04-Oct-18 12:27 PM";"what is the format of this `secret`?

is this a correct statement:   so the sender has ""pre-spent"" the funds into the channel.   The channel is always available (until channel is closed) for recipient to reveal secret for that tx in the channel.";"";"";
455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:31 PM";"the sender can close the channel and reclaim funds";"";"";
423176312354635779;"gcharang#6833";"04-Oct-18 12:31 PM";"The channel is nothing but a output created by the sender. it will have the following constraints:
1) It will only be ever spendable either by the receiver or sender
2) receiver can only spend it by revealing a secret only the sender knows (so making a payment means
column2: the sender is reveling a secret)";"";"";

column1: 455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:32 PM";"but the sender cant reclaim the funds until after the close channel is notarized";"";"";
455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:33 PM";"so the sender has total control by releasing secrets and as soon as it hits the mempool
column2: it is secured by dPoW that the receiver will receive payment";"";"";

column1: 455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:33 PM";"and all of it is blockchain enforced in a backward compatible way";"";"";
455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:33 PM";"this is why I say channels CC is an improved LN";"";"";
455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 12:33 PM";"the method for secret revealing is via hashchain
column2: very efficient encoding of hash secrets";"";"";
in case of re-org
column3: can just re-reveal the secret to receive the funds in the channel tx.  (lots of things to consider)

column1: hashchain - yes i recall reading it now.  clever/efficient üòÉ";"";"";

column3: and by a new CC dev";"";"üôå (4)";

column1: 424224648889106444;"Mihailo#5902";"04-Oct-18 01:03 PM";"I would describe the channel CC like this:
1) sender ""lock"" funds in the channel CC address that is spendable by sender or receiver ONLY!
2) then sender make payments to receiver in new transacitons
column2: and in that payment tx also the secret for that amount is now known

column1: 3) if receiver wants to make a payment (this will usually be done only when the payment from sender some how did not reach receiver - for example chain reorg) he must provide the secret. This implies that receiver was online and saw the tx with payment from sender and noted the secret for that payment
4) if sender wants to withdraw fund from channel (he do not want to have channel to receiver anymore)
column2: then he first must do a close tx which will just mark that channel will be closed and receiver can see that
column3: and then after close tx is confirmed he can issue refund tx and take the funds.";"";"üëç (2)";

column1: 424224648889106444;"Mihailo#5902";"04-Oct-18 01:10 PM";"As jl777c mentioned the biggest advantage of channel CC is that it has enabled to secure payments that are in mempool with dPoW. I first did not realised how
column2: but with this explanation it gets a lot clearer:

column1: - when the channel is opened and that open tx is notarised basically it means that the amount locked in channel address is known that it will definitively reach either receiver or back to sender. Now when payments are done
column2: by the time they reach mempool
column3: both sides can see them and the secret which is needed to spend them. So
column4: it is not needed to wait the tx to end up in the chain or to be confirmed
column5: because as soon the receiver has the secret for the payment he knows he will get those funds. In other words
column6: you can say that when a payment is done it is immediately confirmed.";"";"";

column1: 424224648889106444;"Mihailo#5902";"04-Oct-18 01:15 PM";"In the case that sender closes the channel
column2: he still must wait for notarisation to happen before he can withdraw funds. So the receiver will see that channel will be closed and no more funds will get to him.";"";"";

column1: 455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 01:16 PM";"it enables small chains to be used for point of sale instant payments";"";"üëÜ (1)
455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 01:17 PM";"and once channels CC can pay assets
column2: it can be KMD or even BTC equivalents being sent on the small chain
column3: all secured by dPoW and valid in seconds";"";"";

column2: assets
column3: oracles and gateways combined is hard to fully comprehend";"";"";

column1: 371114647052615681;"Mylo#8306";"04-Oct-18 01:20 PM";"And the sender cannot send the payment and close the channel in a quick enough time
column2: because the closing of the channel requires notarization?";"";"";

column1: 424224648889106444;"Mihailo#5902";"04-Oct-18 01:22 PM";"Sender cannot send payment and withdraw funds quickly
column2: as to withdraw it first must be closed and then the close must be notarised which needs more time than the payment to reach receiver.";"";"";

column1: 455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 01:24 PM";"likely some fancy whitepaper and ICO could have been made for the channels CC
column2: we just implemented it in a month instead";"";"üòπ (1)";

column1: 455741312273219595;"jl777c#5810";"04-Oct-18 01:24 PM";"of course we still need to find all the bugs and fix them and add support for tokens";"";"";

424224648889106444;"Mihailo#5902";"04-Oct-18 01:28 PM";"You must think of channel CC as instant payment where both sides are present because probably there will be some return from receiver in some form (goods
column2: digital stuff ...) . Good example is you are buying coffee in Starbucks
column3: you send the payment to Starbucks and they see it instantly and give you coffee. If you do not send payment they will not give you coffee
column4: if one side (usually the receiver) is not present then you would usually not use channel CC for tx ( but you still can).";"";"";

column2: I think if you are not online all the time
column3: your funds could be at risk";"";"";
